introduction: Helianthus petiolaris is a North American plant species in the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the prairie sunflower[2] or lesser sunflower.[3] Naturalist and botanist Thomas Nuttall was the first to describe the prairie sunflower in 1821.[4][5] The word petiolaris in Latin means, “having a petiole”.[5] The species originated in Western United States, but has since expanded east. The prairie sunflower is sometimes considered a weed.[6]
